column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Make Notes on a PDF on PC or Mac
#Text=This wikiHow teaches you how to take notes and highlight sections on a PDF text document , using your computer 's stock PDF reader app .
#Text=You can use Preview on Mac , and Reader on Windows .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Adding Notes to a PDF
#Text=on Mac
#Text=Open your PDF document in Preview .
#Text=Double-click the PDF document to open it in Mac 's default PDF reader , Preview .
#Text=Press on your keyboard .
#Text=This will show Preview 's markup toolbar at the top of your document .
#Text=Alternatively , you can click the toolbox icon in the upper-right corner of Preview , next to the search bar .
#Text=Click the notepad icon on the markup toolbar .
#Text=This button looks like a square with horizontal lines in it .
#Text=You can find it next to the signature icon at the top .
#Text=This will create a new , yellow notepad sheet .
#Text=It looks like a yellow square on your PDF .
#Text=Click the yellow square to type .
#Text=If the yellow notepad square does n't automatically prompt you to write , click on it again to expand your note sheet .
#Text=Type your note into the yellow notepad .
#Text=Anything you write here will be saved in your note .
#Text=Click anywhere on your PDF .
#Text=This will minimize the pop-up notepad into a yellow square with no text .
#Text=Drag the yellow square anywhere on the PDF .
#Text=You can place your note anywhere on your document .
#Text=Click the yellow square to view your note .
#Text=Clicking will expand the notepad sheet .
#Text=You can view and edit your note here anytime .
#Text=Adding Textboxes on Mac
#Text=Click the icon on the markup toolbar .
#Text=You can find this button on the markup toolbar near the upper-left corner .
#Text=It will add a textbox in the middle of your PDF .
#Text=Hold and drag the textbox anywhere on your PDF .
#Text=You can place the box anywhere on the margins or over the text .
#Text=Double-click on the textbox .
#Text=This will allow you to edit the text in it .
#Text=The placeholder text reads " Text " in the text box .
#Text=Type your notes in the textbox .
#Text=You can use your keyboard to enter your comments or questions here .
#Text=Click the icon on the markup toolbar .
#Text=This button is on the far-right end of the markup toolbar at the top .
#Text=You can edit your text 's font , size , and style here .
#Text=Select a font from the drop-down .
#Text=Enter a number in the " pt " field to change text size .
#Text=Click the color box to select a text color .
#Text=Use the B , I , U icons for bold , italics , and underline .
#Text=Select a text alignment at the bottom .
#Text=Drawing and Sketching on Mac
#Text=Open your PDF document in Preview .
#Text=Double-click the PDF document to open it in Mac 's default PDF reader , Preview .
#Text=Press on your keyboard .
#Text=This will show Preview 's markup toolbar at the top of your document .
#Text=Alternatively , you can click the toolbox icon in the upper-right corner of Preview , next to the search bar .
#Text=Click the pencil icon on the top-right .
#Text=This is the Sketch tool .
#Text=You can find it next to the dashed square icon on the markup toolbar at the top .
#Text=Sketch a line or curve on your PDF .
#Text=You can use this to mark or cross certain sections in the text .
#Text=If Preview is not sure about your sketch , you 'll see a pop-up box in the upper-left corner below the markup toolbar .
#Text=You can select what you meant to draw here .
#Text=Click the three-lines icon on the markup toolbar .
#Text=It 's located next to the notepad icon at the top .
#Text=Select a line thickness .
#Text=The thickness style you select here will automatically apply to your current sketch .
#Text=You can also click a line to select it , then change its thickness here later .
#Text=Click the color square icon next to the three-lines button .
#Text=You can select a color for your sketch lines and curves here .
#Text=Click the pen icon next to the pencil on the markup toolbar .
#Text=This is the Draw tool .
#Text=You can use this tool to draw and sketch free-hand on your PDF .
#Text=You can select a thickness and color from the markup toolbar .
#Text=Draw freely with your cursor on the PDF .
#Text=You can use the Draw tool to mark or cross something in the text or take notes anywhere on the page .
#Text=Adding Notes and Highlighting on Windows
#Text=Open your PDF document in Windows Reader .
#Text=Double-click the PDF document to open it in Windows 's default PDF reader app , Reader .
#Text=If you have another reader app set as your default , right-click your PDF document , hover over Open with , and select Reader here .
#Text=Select a word , sentence , line or paragraph in your PDF .
#Text=Hold down your left mouse button , and select where you want to add your note .
#Text=This will highlight your selection , and show your options in a pop-up toolbox .
#Text=You can select Highlight , Add a note , or Copy here .
#Text=Click in the pop-up toolbox .
#Text=This option looks like a speech balloon icon .
#Text=It will create a small note sheet on your PDF .
#Text=Type your note into the small note sheet .
#Text=Anything you write here will be saved in your note .
#Text=Click anywhere on the PDF .
#Text=This will close the pop-up notepad , and save your note .
#Text=Click the highlighted section on your PDF .
#Text=Your options will pop up on a toolbar .
#Text=Click on the pop-up toolbar .
#Text=This will open your saved note .
#Text=You can view and edit your note here anytime .
#Text=Select any text in your PDF .
#Text=You can select any word , sentence , line or paragraph with your left mouse button .
#Text=This will show your markup options in a pop-up toolbox .
#Text=Click in the pop-up toolbox .
#Text=This will highlight your selection in the text .
#Text=You can easily find this section next time you open your document .
